column4: Does running a KDE app on a GNOME desktop slow the system down?
not on any decent system. it willload more libs and stuff and take up a bit more ram
i mixx and match kde+gnome apps all the time
You mean the ubuntu 'usb startup disk creator' tool ?
if they can ping each other.. install ssh and use scp for easy transfers
or set up some mpre perment shares either via nfs, or samba
leds flashing on keyboard = a nasty hard crash.    perhaps the cd is bad.  or try partitioning it befor you install via gparted.
on old machines it could be  a bad hd. hard to tell.. partition it exaclty how ya want with gparted as a test I guess.
I am running the "disc check" on the CD is that reliable?
should be.
okay I will let that run first.
okay just running the disk check has caused the same flashing lights and a freeze. Any ideas?
sounds bad..  pc may have some nasty issues.
Well I ran the RAM check. Man I have never seen so much ram. I just replaced it and am trying it again.
dust out the pc. :) could be overheating also
it was the RAM.
bam the ram!
ive had ram slots go bad in the past.   can be a real pain to track down
yep.
whats the specs of the box anyway>
It is a 800mgh p3 with 3 sticks of 128 ram an onboard 8 meg video card. The  system is going to be totally dedicated to running ADvanced mame

you might want to track down a more minimal disrto.  Ive built mame box's in the past also. :) whileimhere  there was a 200mb mini-ubuntu variant i saw taht used some lighter window manager and  stuff.. but i forget its name,
ive been playing with TinyCoreLinux lately 10mb :) but i dont think they have a mame package for it.
I will have to build advmame for this
